name: Tomato-Rich Fish Stew
author: Jean Carper
summary: The lycopene in tomatoes protects our brains against age-related decline. Fish's good fat has the same effect.
ingredients: 2 (14 ounce) cans diced tomatoes (no salt added)
1 cup dry red wine (or substitute broth or tomato juice)
4 tablespoons fresh herbs (such as thyme, rosemary or basil)
1 (15 ounce) can navy beans, drained and rinsed
1 pound firm fish (grouper, tilapia or tuna), cut in 2- to 3-inch chunks
1 pinch Salt and pepper, to taste
directions: In a pan, simmer sun-dried tomatoes in 1 1/2 cups water until very soft; discard water
In a large pot, saute onion and green pepper in oil until softened
In a food processor or blender, combine sun-dried tomatoes and 1 bottle clam juice until smooth; add to pot
Stir in remaining clam juice, diced tomatoes, wine, garlic, herbs, bay leaves and olives
Add beans, fish, fennel seeds, salt and pepper
Simmer until fish is done, about 10 minutes
Ladle into bowls; sprinkle with cheese
